mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: West facade of south addition looking north, showing Garden Room entrance and entrance to basement dining room in foreground, from across Garrett Alley

Hotel E was used for its original purpose from 1825 to the early 20th century. It has served as faculty residences and as the University's first architecture school (1919) under Fiske Kimball, and has reverted to a dining facility as an extension of the Colonnade Club. [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: James Murray Howard University of Virginia Historic Buildings and Grounds Collection
